markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

rapidcityjournal.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the Rapid City Journal, a daily newspaper that covers the Rapid City, South Dakota, area.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Rapid City Journal is owned by Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded, Iowa-based media company that owns more than 40 daily newspapers and almost 300 specialty publications across the United States. Rapidcityjournal.com gets revenue from advertisements, promotions, sponsored content, and a paywall for subscriptions..

Content

Rapidcityjournal.com covers news, sports, entertainment, opinion, and obituaries for the Rapid City, South Dakota, area. The site posts national and international news from The Associated Press, CNN, and other news providers.

Credibility

Articles on the site are balanced and often based on firsthand reporting and multiple sources. Headlines accurately reflect the content of articles.

Transparency

The website posts the names, email addresses, and phone number of management and editorial staff. Articles written by the Journalâ€™s staff are bylined. Advertising and sponsored content are clearly labeled. The site makes it clear how to contact the publication to report possible errors, and the site frequently posts corrections. Opinion is separated from news content.

History

The Rapid City Journal was first published in January 1878 as the Black Hills Journal.

Written by:
Lillian Childress

Edited by:
Eric Effron Jim Warren
